name: NodeSchool St. Petersburg
description:
NodeSchool Chapter at St. Petersburg, FL.

These are in-person hosted workshops, in which workshoppers are used as curriculum and mentors help attendees work through the challenges.

Join us and learn you some Node.js and JavaScript!

Code of Conduct

name: Hyperledger Brussels
description:
Does The Hyperledger Project have the potential to become the engine behind most successful decentralized applications and organizations created in the next 25-50 years? Absolutely!

A much better question is how, and in what new ways, can we:

a) Build decentralized applications, organizations and APIs at 10x the speed at 1/10 the cost.

b) Build situational awareness in the local community, as the convergence of decentralized applications, decentralized organizations, Artificial Intelligence and IoT brings upon us the Great Displacement of the 21st century, where the majority of workforce will be left without “conventional” jobs, forced to learn new skills and professions.

Why?

Because with Hyperledger we can.

Founders of this group believe that the Hyperledger Foundation will be the engine behind decentralization of the world, a massive economic change of the next 25-50 years.

So.... why don't we standardize and democratize the field with and around Hyperledger?

What.

We are a local micro community of those interested in advancing their knowledge of Hyperledger, its use cases and applications.

How.

Join our group for a regular dose of human interaction, conversations, smiles, food and drinks on all things Hyperledger:

• Use Cases

• Competitive Analysis of Hyperledger Startups (Distributed Apps from disruptive companies in specific vertical markets)

• How-To’s

• Interviews with individuals working at the edge of the Hyperledger project

• Reviews of tools, services and APIs offered by the Hyperledger ecosystem

• Best Practices in Application Architecture

• Do’s and Don’ts

• Application Templates

• Hackathons

• Security in the decentralized world - on the edge, on the node, in the cloud and in transit

We will learn how others solve some of the hard problems that exist in the world using Hyperledger.

Join the movement. Let’s change the world. Because with Hyperledger we can.

name: Be more JS
description:
Brno needs more JS, be more JS.
JavaScript je dnes jedním z nejpoužívanějších a nejzajímavějších jazyků. Pokud souhlasíš tak patříš k nám. Nečekej ani chvilku a přijď. Budeme si povídat o JS, ES6, React, Angular, Redux, Node.js, RxJS prostě o tom co děláme a co umíme nejlíp. Chceme diskutovat nad skutečnými problémy, motivovat se navzájem a sdílet své znalosti.
Že jste nikdy neslyšeli o Dixons Carphone? Tak to je další důvod proč přijít, protože my rozhodně máme co říct a chceme si povídat s lidmi, jejichž myšlenky nás obohatí a posunou zase o kus dál.

name: TypeScript all the Things!
description:
Let's share ideas about web and mobile software system development,
focusing on TypeScript as a common language for servers, web browsers, mobile, desktop, and even micro-controllers. We will discuss open-source technologies that are part of building working systems, such as: javascript/TypeScript, npm, node.js, express.js, Angular2, HTML5/CSS3, mongodb, NativeScript, mocha+chai, git, and Tessel.

TypeScript, typescriptlang.org, is a superset of javascript that adds optional type declarations.

organizer.name: Peter Snider
organizer.bio:
Long career in digital road maps and navigation. 
...
now working on startup using TS-on-Node.js + Angular2.

name: SF Realtime Coders
description: Realtime App Development from Starter 101 concepts to advanced network topology discussions. Socket.IO, SignalR, SocksJS, Faye, PubNub, Node.JS and more.  You should join if you are a developer who is enthusiastic about realtime on the web, native or on any platform.  This is a developer focused meet about highly technical concepts and raw code.

name: Nashville MEAN Stack Development Meetup
description: A group for anyone interested in the MEAN stack, Javascript,  Node.js, Javascript frameworks, AngularJS, Express and related tools.

organizer.name: Chris Schaub
organizer.bio: I'm a Nashville, Tennessee based singer, songwriter, guitarist, percussionist, lutenist and computer programmer. I'm also a Technical Lead / computer programmer working for the Horton Group specializing in custom application development.

name: Washington DC Apache Hive Users Group
description:
We are the Washington DC area (Includes Northern Virginia and Maryland) Users Group solely focused on Apache Hive. Most of our meetups will occur in Northwest DC but may also take place in Northern Virginia and Maryland from time to time. We strive to share our experiences with each other in the group to foster an atmosphere of learning and adoption of Apache Hive. We also bring in speakers that are highly involved in the Apache Hadoop community to speak on related topics.

Hive is a scalable data warehouse infrastructure built on top of Hadoop. It provides tools to enable easy data ETL, a mechanism to put structures on the data, and the capability for querying and analysis of large data sets stored in Hadoop files. Hive defines a simple SQL-like query language, called HiveQL, that enables users familiar with SQL to query the data. At the same time, this language also allows programmers who are familiar with the MapReduce framework to be able to plug in their custom mappers and reducers to perform more sophisticated analysis that may not be supported by the built-in capabilities of the language. The biggest Hive deployment to date is the silver cluster at Facebook Inc, which consists of 1100 nodes with 8 CPU cores and 12 1TB-disk each. This translates into a cluster of 8800 CPU cores and 13PB of raw storage. Hive does not mandate read or write data be in the "Hive format"---there is no such thing. Hive works equally well on Thrift, control delimited, or your specialized data formats. Please see File Format and SerDe in Developer Guide for details. http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/Hive

name: DC Red Hat User Group (RHUG)
description: The D.C. Red Hat User Group (RHUG) is focused on bringing together the D.C. Red Hat user community for business and technical presentations, conversations and perhaps some food and drink. Membership is open to Red Hat customers, partners and people interested in Red Hat technologies. Some of the Red Hat products are: Red Hat Enterprise Linux, OpenStack, Storage (Ceph, GlusterFS), Virtualization (ovirt, kvm), CloudForms, FeedHenry (Node.js, Apache Cordova), JBoss Fuse (Apache Camel, Fabric8), JBoss BPM (jBPM), JBoss Data Virtualization (Teiid), JBoss EAP (Wildfly), JBoss JWS (Apache Tomcat), JBoss Data Grid (Infinispan), JBoss A-MQ (Apache ActiveMQ), JBoss BRMS (Drools), OpenShift (Jenkins, Git, Kubernetes, Docker, OpenVSwitch, RHEL, RHEL Atomic).

organizer.name: Crystal Murphy
organizer.bio: I manage events for North America in the Regional Demand Center of Red Hat.

name: NYC JavaScript + Node.js + Backbone.js
description: Cutting-edge JavaScript-tech including Nodejs and Backbone.

name: .seed - Engineering Jobs NYC Meetup
description:
.seed is a new staffing firm for a new age. 


Our goal is to help start-ups and start-up minded companies plant the seeds that will eventually sprout into their most important assets (PEOPLE). 


Combining old school work ethics, with a new school outlook on technology staffing, we see our greatest value as recruiters in our ability to: 

• Have our candidates’ best interests at heart; not our bottom lines 

• See our clients as innovators; not job requisitions 

• Allow both client and candidate to naturally match; not force a match 

• Nurture both Candidate and Client to the end where Trust is cornerstone 


Our Concentration: 

• Fullstack Engineers

• Back-end Engineers (NODE, GO, Ruby, Java, Python, etc) 

• Front-end Engineers (React/Angular/Backbone, etc) 

• Mobile Developers (iOS/Android) 

• Devops/Sys Admin

organizer.name: Rob Rothman
organizer.bio:
I'm head of a Mobile Recruiting Group in Midtown NYC. 

I help find jobs for:
iOS/Android Developers
UX/UI Designers
Product Managers
Fullstack Developers

My clients include the likes of:
American Express
Tinder
Hinge
iHeartRadio
NYTimes
Time, Inc.

name: Cloud Native Chicago
description:
Cloud Native Chicago is a local chapter of the Cloud Native Computing Foundation.

The mission of the CNCF is to create and drive the adoption of a new computing paradigm that is optimized for modern distributed systems environments capable of scaling to tens of thousands of self healing multi-tenant nodes.

https://www.cncf.io/about/charter

name: Let's Learn Programming in Worcester, MA!
description:
This group is a place for like minded people to learn, improve and share programming experience. Please join us! 

We will aim to host events where we can work to become proficient in the MEAN stack (MongoDB, ExpressJS, AngularJS and node.js).  We will explore PHP and Ruby as well! 

We all learn at different paces; some of us will be able to learn in quickly and some of us will take longer, but don't let that deter you!  We would like to welcome to the group, complete newbies, intermediary level and experience programmers! 

We all can learn something and help each other. We would love to hear from you if you would like to help us on this venture.   We will gladly accept all collaboration in developing a study guide/curriculum.

name: Learn Cassandra & Spark (Waltham MA)
description:
This is a meetup group for anyone who is interested in learning Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.

Apache Cassandra is an open source database - Highly Scalable, High Performance, High Availability - Can run on more than 1000 nodes in a single cluster.

Apache Spark is a fast engine for large-scale data processing - 100 times faster than Hadoop. Write applications quickly in Java, Scala or Python. Spark can perform complex analytics on data stored in Cassandra.

Join this group and let's learn Apache Cassandra & Apache Spark.


*** If you have experience with Apache Cassandra and/or Apache Spark, please join our group and help us learn, these new exciting technologies ***

name: Greater Boston Enterprise UI
description: Greater Boston Enterprise UI is a Meetup group for anyone who is interested in learning, understanding and sharing about topics surrounding developing User Interface in the enterprise context. We define UI as a large spectrum that spans across technology stacks and could include the various JavaScript frameworks, HTML, CSS, Node.js, tooling & automation (Grunt & gulp), and testing (Selenium and Webdriver). Basically anything that would face a UI developer on a daily basis. Our goal is to connect passionate individuals who care about making innovative and user-focused interfaces and experiences that have a big impact. If you're interested in speaking at our events, please reach out to us. We look forward to hearing from you!

name: San Antonio Meteor Meetup
description: This is a group for anyone interested in Meteor and its associated technologies, like Node.js, MongoDB, Angular.js, React.js, Jade, Spacebars, Famous-Views, JSON, etc. It's all about developing modern interactive web applications. All skill levels are welcome. If you are, or want to be, a Meteorite, then this group is for you!

name: Open Source .NET Web Development
description:
Meetup for those who want to learn and share information about using open source technologies with Microsoft infrastructures. Azure, SignalR, Web.API, Entity Framework, for solid reliable applications combined with HTMLbars, Handlebars, Ember, Angular, Node, and all kinds of other cool awesome JavaScript libraries that can really bring your web applications to the next level!

We're looking for people who really want to learn this stuff, but what you do during the day job might be very different.  For a lot of people with backgrounds with Microsoft technology, they may work on more traditional applications (even just old school asp.net webforms with maybe ajaxtoolkits or other somewhat abandoned Microsoft technologies), but we're going to be doing a lot of talking about what might be fun to do in your spare time, your next job, or even techniques that can improve what you're working on today!

name: HackDojo Orange County: Hackers & Developers
description:
LEARN TO CODE. CHANGE THE WORLD. HACKDOJO.

HackDojo is a place of study, and collaboration dedicated to learn coding to create a better future. HackDojo is a self-directed, coding program for people who want to learn or get better at programming. 

Come learn or meet people with the following skills:
HTML5 and CSS3
Twitter Bootstrap
JavaScript fundamentals and Libraries
jQuery and AJAX
Angular.JS
Node.js
MongoDB
Express.js
jQuery Mobile
AppGyver
Phonegap
Ruby on Rails
LAMP Stack
iOS Swift
Android
APIs
Web Socket
Stripe
Test Driven Development
Deployment
Git and Github
Docker
PHP/MySQL
Python

..join us at our next meetup event and meet other founders, hackers, coders, programmers and aspiring developers!

Learn more at HackDojo.com!

organizer.name: Ounie Phakousonh
organizer.bio: Director at School of Devs - Web and Mobile Development Bootcamp in Orange County, CA.

name: OC Emerging Technologies Meetup
description: Hey OC Developers! Join our group and get together to network, discuss and learn about the hottest web technologies, Angular, Node.js and more. The early members of the group are part of the team working at Verys, one of Irvine's fastest growing software dev shops.  We are looking to network with other local developers, showing off some of the cool stuff we are doing and hearing about what you are up to.  Whether you are a Sr. Developer or just starting to explore web technologies, we want you!
